title: spec: be clear that 'make' creates an underlying array
body:
by **peter.buchmann.68**: 
This is just a documentation / help text issue.

It appears to me, that a slice can either be derived
as a pointer to a range of an EXISTING array - 
or - if it is being created with make(...) then it
is a pointer to a range of an IMPLICITLY CREATED array.

I believe the documentation could be more clear
- or just tell me I am mistaken.
